kanji-cam.name: Kanji Cam (kanji.cam)
kanji-cam.info: Kanji Cam is a fun and effortless way to learn Japanese kanji by simply taking pictures. Kanji Cam handles the chore of creating and sorting flashcards so you can focus on your Japanese learning goals. Kanji are scanned via OCR using a custom UI front-end built around Tesseract.js.

caravana.name: Caravana
caravana.info: Caravana is a full-stack marketplace app allowing users to rent-out or reserve recreational vehicles. Developed as a project at Le Wagon Coding Bootcamp.

nobsqr.name: NoBSQR.com
nobsqr.info: Frustrated by the lack of hassle-free and privacy-respecting QR code generators available online, I created my own client-side utility for generating QR codes without any “BS” (hence the name). The site uses a package I developed called NoBSQR.js, which includes support for features often locked behind paywalls, such as custom colors, transparency, pixel-rounding, and URL/text labels.

this.name: This Page
this.info: I created this portfolio page from scratch in vanilla HTML5 / CSS / JS without AI assistance to showcase my front-end ability. In lieu of a database, details about each project are loaded in from a JSON file using the fetch API, then injected into an HTML template. With the exception of Bootstrap, this project is dependency-free.

gematria-pro.name: Gematria.pro
gematria-pro.info: Gematria.pro is a simple, powerful, and free gematria calculator. The calculator allows you to check the numerical value of words in English, Greek, and Hebrew according to over 40 different cipher methods. You can share links to interesting results, or download results as an image file to your computer.

vetris.name: Vetris
vetris.info: This is my take on the classic game, Tetris. The game is implemented using vanilla HTML5 / CSS / JS and created using 100% NI (natural intelligence) :P

2048.info: This is my take on the game, 2048. The goal is to combine blocks of the same number until you create a 2048 block. This game supports touch controls for mobile users.

matchgame.name: Match Game
matchgame.info: This is my implementation of a simple card-matching memory game. This game supports up to 8 players (local) and touch controls. Implemented in vanilla HTML5 / CSS / JS.

verdict.name: VeRdict (VR Dictionary)
verdict.info: VeRdict is a bilingual Japanese-English dictionary component that can be used inside Unity-based VR applications, such as VRChat. In addition to basic word search, VeRdict can display 3D models corresponding to a target word, and interactive labels can be added to objects within the 3D scene that link to dictionary entries. Research presented at iLRN2021.
